It is because of kids like Jordan that it is so important to continue to invest in 21st century science so we can discover & unlock new treatments & therapies that will save lives. https://www.facebook.com/CongresswomanSusanWBrooks/posts/1638743796172520 …pic.twitter.com/WZxM5jqw3k

During today's hearing, I was able to meet Jordan & his mom, Laura. Jordan is an 8yr old #Hoosier who loves building w/legos. He is living Duchenne Muscular Dystrophy & traveled from Indy to advocate for accelerated access to treatments for people living w/ #rarediseases.pic.twitter.com/WFAI2IH7qn
HAPPENING NOW: Asking questions at #SubHealth hearing on 21st Century Cures >>https://energycommerce.house.gov/hearings/implementing-21st-century-cures-act-update-fda-nih/ …

21st Century Cures also made great strides to reform our mental healthcare system to improve care for those with mental illness, strengthen our nation’s #mentalhealth workforce, & ensure communication between providers, families & patients.

At the same time, $1 billion was included in 21st Century Cures to address the heroin & #opioidcrisis that is hitting #Hoosiers hard as part of the Comprehensive Addiction & Recovery Act (CARA). Read more about CARA >>https://susanwbrooks.house.gov/issues/addressing-substance-abuse …

As part of 21st Century Cures, the Strengthening Public Health Emergency Response Act, was signed into law, legislation I introduced w/@RepAnnaEshoo to improve U.S. #biodefense efforts & incentivize the development of vaccines for dangerous/deadly pathogens as identified by DHS

The 21st Century Cures Act is an innovation game-changer that accelerates the discovery, development & delivery of safe cures & treatments for families across the country & keeps the United States on the cutting edge of medical #innovation.

Under @RepFredUpton & @RepDianaDeGette’s leadership, we were able to pass the #bipartisan 21st Century Cures Act to help kids w/ #rarediseases, like Max. Max is w/us today celebrating this milestone legislation.pic.twitter.com/83e9er8Dyu

LIVE: Remember 21st Century Cures? Last year it was signed into law & today, #SubHealth receives an update on its implementation from @ScottGottliebMD at the @US_FDA & @NIHDirector at @NIH >> https://energycommerce.house.gov/hearings/implementing-21st-century-cures-act-update-fda-nih/ … #CuresNow
With the passage of this resolution, we are one step closer to expressing to the nation that sexual harassment in any capacity is wrong and must be prevented and stopped.
It is absolutely unacceptable to be subjected to harassment or discrimination of any kind, anywhere.

Thank you to @RepComstock for introducing a resolution I am proud to support, that is an important & appropriate first step to educate Members of Congress & their staff on inappropriate workplace actions & how to report such conduct. https://susanwbrooks.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/video-brooks-supports-resolution-to-combat-harassment-and-discrimination …pic.twitter.com/7Hijifmm6W

Our courageous #policeofficers will now get better access to the care they deserve w/#HR2228, the Law Enforcement Mental Health & Wellness Act of 2017. Read more >>https://www.gop.gov/the-importance-of-mental-health-among-police-officers/ …

The Law Enforcement #MentalHealth & Wellness Act of 2017 that I introduced earlier this year w/my colleagues @RepValDemings @RepDougCollins @BillPascrell & @davereichert just passed the House of Representatives. Here is what we have to say about it >>https://susanwbrooks.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/house-unanimously-passes-law-enforcement-mental-health-and-wellness-act …

ICYMI: Tonight, I spoke on the House Floor in support of a bill I introduced earlier this year, H.R. 2228, the Law Enforcement Mental Health & Wellness Act of 2017. WATCH >>https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=it3gfBfcIqk&feature=youtu.be …

The passage of the Law Enforcement Mental Wellness Act through the House today ensures that we are 1step closer to supporting the men & women in #lawenforcement w/the resources they need to stay healthy while selflessly serving our communities & keeping us safe.

.@boonecosheriff Mike Nielsen’s daughter, also a police officer, tried to take her own life b/c she was struggling w/PTSD after responding to a murder case. Nielsen’s daughter didn't have access to services that could help her process & cope w/the situation she faced that day.
Our #policeofficers face a culture of silence when it comes to #mentalhealth challenges, & they need better access to mental health services to help them cope w/unforgettable situations.

WATCH LIVE: About to speak on the House Floor in support of my bill, #HR2228, the Law Enforcement & Mental Wellness Act >> https://www.c-span.org/video/?437737-3/us-house-meets-legislative-business&live …

(1/2) Every woman/girl in the world deserves the same dignity, respect & sense of security as any man/boy. It is heartbreaking to continue hearing stories about violence against women. This issue is not going away & while the problem is clearly defined, solutions are not.

(2/2) I’m encouraged by Phumzile Mlambo-Ngcuka’s work to protect women/girls. Thoughtful dialogue & proposed laws are both steps in the right direction. It takes a special person to dedicate themselves to a career in law enforcement. There is no higher calling.
Our panel agrees: Although there's been a decrease in candidates interested in law enforcement careers, these jobs are rewarding.
A thorough background check is required for many of these jobs. Your actions could close doors that you didn't even know you wanted to open!
Critical skills for Sheriff's department employees? Communication skills are key. Prefer candidates have some college or military experience
U.S. Attorney Minkler says there's often a gap when people haven't learned about losing and how to overcome challenges & setbacks.
What does it take to be a U.S. Attorney or to work for one?Need to be able to collaborate, lead, be part of team and handle adversity.
What does it take to be a prosecutor? Strong writing and grammar skills, professionalism, read a lot, and a record of volunteering.pic.twitter.com/w69C5bq4YY
What do you need to be a 911 dispatcher in @HamiltonCoIN? Be able to think on your feet, use common sense, stay calm & wear lots of hats.
Jobs in our local & state courts need people who are multi-taskers, organizers & managers w/ tech & keyboarding skills.
Our panelists agree: the best gift you can give to your students is the gift of language.
Our courts need bilingual employees, esp. attorneys & bailiffs. Candidates should be fluent in language & culture to better serve people.pic.twitter.com/UqpMwtfqTR

Connecting Careers & Classrooms bridges the gap that sometimes exists between educators & local job creators.
Teachers, guidance counselors & school administrators need to understand the skills local jobs require so they can help kids develop them.
This is our 6th Connecting Careers & Classrooms event. These events connect educators w/ leaders in local business & government.
Check back here at 1 p.m. for more insights about how our schools can better prepare kids for careers in criminal justice and public service

@awsmith46 Most people born after 1980 have not been vaccinated.
Wondering why smallpox is a bio-threat? Most people born after 1980 are not vaccinated, and the mortality rate is close to 40%.
Thanks to today's bio-threat exercise participants: #IN05 emergency management, public health, healthcare providers & first responders.
Takeaway: Bio-threats are messy & complex. But w/ good preparation & public awareness we can protect our national security & public health.
Takeaway: There are no easy answers when it comes to biodefense.
Takeaways: We need an anticipatory approach to bio-threats like smallpox. Government and public alike need to prepare before an outbreak.
Takeaways: The U.S. is facing major policy decisions that impact our preparedness & response. Local partners need certainty for success.
Takeaways: Risk of biological threats is real to #IN05.pic.twitter.com/hClmaG1Ro6
Next question: who can help first responders deploy mass vaccinations & are they part of #IN05 bio-threat plans?pic.twitter.com/6bX5hKUfAP

Participants say - stay ahead of the outbreak w/ leadership from #IN05 politicians & public health officials. Do you agree?
New information changes today's bio-threat exercise - now 100,000 cases of smallpox expected. How will this impact decisions for #IN05?
